description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Lisbon's Charm" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Lisbon's Charm

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a churchyard, Miradouro da Senhora do Monte sits atop one of Lisbon's seven hills, offering unparalleled panoramic views of the city. From this vantage point, visitors can marvel at the enchanting Sao Jorge Castle, the charming Moorish quarter of Alfama with its labyrinthine streets and whitewashed buildings, and the tranquil Tagus River meandering through the landscape.

sources.snippet: Start your day with a romantic stroll through the winding streets and end it watching the sunset from one of the viewpoints in the area, such as Miradouro das Portas do Sol or Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. The panoramic view of the Tagus River is simply breathtaking. Immerse yourself in the city at dusk with a sunset walk* and treat yourself to an intimate traditional dinner accompanied by an exciting live Fado* performance.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon, 2025

sources.snippet: Perched high above Lisbon, Miradouro da Senhora do Monte reveals itself as one of the most enchanting hidden gems for lovers in Lisbon. This charming spot, known for its breathtaking panoramic views of the city, provides a perfect backdrop for romantic moments. As you stand together on the hilltop, you'll find the city's lights twinkling like stars, setting a romantic atmosphere.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024
10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Miradouro da Senhora do Monte

reviews.text: The most beautiful place to watch sunsets in Lisbon is from the viewpoint at Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. As the sun dips below the horizon, the sky transforms into a canvas of vibrant oranges and purples, casting a warm glow over the city. Locals and tourists alike gather here, sharing stories and laughter as they take in the breathtaking scenery. With the iconic rooftops over the Tagus River stretching out below, it's a moment that feels both timeless and fleeting. Must watch the Sunset there when in Lisbon! üòçüåÖ

Stunning views of the city. It's an uphill climb to get there, but absolutely worth it. Lots of people will be there with you if you go at golden hour, but it's still lovely. Being amongst a bunch of travelers is serene in its own way. There's a beer cart there! Grab a drink and enjoy the view.

A stunning view of the city.
It's a bit of a tiring walk uphill but if your prepared for it its nice to explore the area.
There's plenty of space for pictures when you reach it. With lots of nice cafe's and restaurants close by if you need a break.
I'd definitely recommend checking it out for an atmospheric view and pictures if you have time.

places.generalDescription: If you're in Lisbon, a visit to Past√©is de Bel√©m is a must. This large bakery cafe has been serving up Portuguese baked goods since 1837, including their famous custard tarts based on an ancient recipe from a nearby monastery. After indulging in these delectable treats, take some time to explore the Belem district where you'll find attractions like the National Coach Museum and the Museum of Art, Architecture, and Technology.

sources.snippet: Visitors flock here for the incredible Past√©is de Bel√©m, the rivals to the pastel de nata custard tarts found in central Lisbon. This bakery dates all the way back to 1837 and claims to use  an ancient recipe from the monastery situated next door. Don‚Äôt fret over the long lines, they go quickly ‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôll all be forgotten when you sink your teeth into their delectable tarts.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: Past√©is de Bel√©m

reviews.text:
A visit to Past√©is de Bel√©m is a must when in Lisbon. The coffee was excellent ‚Äì rich and smooth ‚Äì and paired perfectly with their famous pastel de nata. The custard tart was absolutely delicious: warm, creamy, with a perfectly crisp and flaky pastry. It's easy to see why this place has such a great reputation.

The atmosphere is charming and full of history, making the experience even more enjoyable. Whether you're a local or a tourist, this spot is the perfect place for a sweet break.

The first time I visited it was amazing, there was a long queue and after arriving inside the building I saw a spacious room with lots of tables and lots of guests sitting and enjoying it, after I enjoyed it so wildly I liked it, it was a bit different from most because it had its own pastry characteristics, making it unique.

After my third visit I could find that the standard  changes from the taste, and even the cleanliness I saw was not very clean because on the production floor I found "HAIR" (you can see it in the video I showed)

We waited for a takeaway, and the line on a Sunday afternoon was about 5 minutes, which wasn't bad at all. The dessert was amazing - really full of flavor. And at only ‚Ç¨1.50 per piece, it's a great deal!

places.generalDescription: Miradouro de Santa Luzia is a popular observation deck in Lisbon, Portugal, offering stunning views of the city and the Tagus River. As one of the many miradouros in Lisbon, it provides a striking perspective of the district of Alfama and its red-tiled roofs. With its pergola and dramatic vistas, it's a perfect spot for capturing Instagram-worthy snaps.

sources.snippet: The Miradouro de Santa Luzia is the perfect spot to watch the sunset with your partner. This beautiful viewpoint is right in the heart of the Alfama neighborhood, which is brimming with quaint vibes. From this viewpoint, you will get views of the city‚Äôs red-tiled roofs, the Tagus River, and the boats coming into the port.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 19 Extra Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon Portugal

sources.snippet: Speaking of views‚Ä¶ if you haven‚Äôt found a cute lover‚Äôs nook to nibble away on your picnic lunch, then start drifting down the hill to enjoy it in one of the area‚Äôs various lookouts, like the Miradouro de Santa Luzia, which has a gorgeous bougainvillea draped pergola, a lovely garden and charming church.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: To the sound of the tram bells, seeing the beauty of the city of the seven hills. This is the proposal for the Miradouro de Santa Luzia, one of the most beautiful in the city. With magnificent tiles to decorate, you will find a garden, a water mirror and a kiosk with a terrace.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic places in Lisbon for Valentine's Day!

places.name: Miradouro de Santa Luzia

reviews.text: A beautiful place to overlook the city by the water. You have several caf√©s and eating spots and a lot of activities nearby. Most of the time it's kind of crowded but I've been there a few times and there's always space to enjoy the view
A very lovely patio with a great view! And it is free! Could be a bit crowded but would recommend to take a visit on your way down from the castle, as the view will not disappoint you for sure!

Beautiful trees and area.  Do suggest always staying vigilant since always people around trying to sell things now during busy summer months.  Area would have been nicer with water in fountain but things are so hot here and water probably needs to be properly managed it's safer not to use it.

places.address: Largo de Santa Luzia, 1100-487 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Monument to the Discoveries, also known as Padrao dos Descobrimentos, was originally built in 1940 and made permanent in 1960 to commemorate 500 years since the death of Henry the Navigator. It stands as a prominent symbol of Lisbon, celebrating the courageous individuals who participated in the Age of Discovery during the 15th and 16th centuries.

sources.snippet: Enjoy a captivating journey along the Tagus River with a boat trip, showcasing iconic landmarks like Bel√©m Tower and the Discoveries Monument with stunning views.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Monument to the Discoveries

reviews.text: Beautiful and impressive monument. Long line, so instead of going up, we enjoyed the pictures from the top posted in another review. I feel we didn't miss much. Got another nice view from the ferry on the way back.

The Monuments to Discovery - A Symbol of Exploration and Adventure

Located in front of a beautiful beach with a stunning view, The Monuments to Discovery serve as a powerful reminder of human curiosity and the spirit of exploration. These monuments commemorate the age of discovery, honoring explorers who ventured into the unknown and expanded the horizons of our world.

Set against the backdrop of the sparkling sea and a picturesque beach, with boats gently drifting nearby, the monuments inspire a sense of adventure and wonder. They invite visitors to reflect on the journeys that shaped history and to appreciate the beauty of discovery.

Whether you're relaxing by the beach or taking in the view, The Monuments to Discovery stand as a testament to exploration, curiosity, and the limitless possibilities of human spirit.

Probably the most impressive monument in Lisbon. I did not expect it to be so big, and also that it had two faces. The history being it is amazing and the views mesmerizing, especially the one from the west, with the bridge in the background. A must visit in Lisbon without a doubt.

places.generalDescription: LX Factory, located in Alcantara, Lisbon, is a revitalized historical industrial complex that has transformed into a vibrant hub for art, design, and gastronomy. This former abandoned area now houses an eclectic mix of creative businesses including design companies, artsy retailers, unique restaurants and bookshops. The industrial atmosphere of the space provides a home to numerous craft shops offering original concepts such as handwoven rugs and cushions at Saudade Design and artisanal preserves at Comur.

sources.snippet: For a contemporary artsy vibe, start venturing east (where we‚Äôll spend the afternoon) to the LX Factory. Set within the buildings of an abandon 19th-century textiles factory, the sprawling complex is a hub of  today‚Äôs creative Lisbon. Home to start-ups and art spaces, the ground floor is abound with design shops and hip caf√©s, so you can start with brunch amongst Lisbon‚Äôs cool locals then spend some time browsing.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: Imagine a place where history meets creativity and old warehouses transform into artistic hubs ‚Äì that's LX Factory in Lisbon. With its industrial charm, it's like stepping into a world of endless possibilities. You'll stroll through graffiti-adorned streets, savour delightful meals at romantic restaurants in Lisbon, and explore quirky shops.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a more adventurous date, try the LxFactory. This old industrial complex was turned into a space for art, design, dining, and entertainment. It is located under the Ponte 25 de Abril bridge and is covered in beautiful murals from contemporary artists.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 19 Extra Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon Portugal

sources.snippet: Belem is one of Lisbon‚Äôs most beautiful areas and home to some of the city‚Äôs most important historical sights: The Jeronimos Monastery, The Monument to the Discoveries and Belem Tower.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon, Portugal

places.name: LX Factory

reviews.text: A nice place with an interesting mix of shops and charming little restaurants. The atmosphere is lovely, especially on weekdays. On weekends, however, it can get quite crowded and noisy - something to keep in mind if you're looking for a quieter experience.

Depending on your goal, this can be a short or a long visit. My partner and I ended up spending three hours here because we are probably the target audience for a lot of amazing designing really strong emphasis on the unique with interesting textiles. I would recommend Probably skipping the restaurants if you want a memorable meal but if you're looking for strong fashion or souvenir, even things for the home is a good choice. All the other reviews are correct there is almost no air-conditioning and it is hot but it's doable.

Really cool area in Lisbon populated by boutiques (or ‚Äúconcept stores‚Äù as Lisbon residents love to say) and eateries, there are also some nice pieces of urban street art around.

On a Sunday, there's a small market that also operates which elevates the experience.

With everything from sunglasses stores to axe-throwing, there's a sprawling mix of fun things around the main factory. At the moment, it's only really the ground level that's fully occupied, but level 1 has some studio space and increasingly classes are appearing up there. With two more levels above that are largely empty at present, this area is only going to continue to evolve and come more cool. It's definitely one we'll revisit next time we're in the city.

places.address: R. Rodrigues de Faria 103, 1300-501 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Bel√©m Tower is a medieval fortified tower located on a small river island, offering stunning views of the estuary from its rooftop terrace. Visitors can enjoy strolling around the area and taking pictures by the LOVE sign. For a unique experience, sunset cruises departing from the port provide an opportunity to explore Lisbon and its landmarks, including cruising under the San Francisco-style bridge. Families can also visit nearby attractions such as St.

sources.snippet: These trips, which last around two hours, also offer a view of Lisbon‚Äôs most popular landmarks from a different angle, including the bright Pra√ßa do Com√©rcio square, the dome of the National Pantheon, the 25 de Abril bridge, and the Bel√©m Tower.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couples Guide To Lisbon

sources.snippet: A nice place to stroll, admire the enchanting Bel√©m tower and take selfies by the LOVE sign, but an even better way to see the area, and all of Lisbon, is on the fantastic sunset cruises offered by Lisbon by Boat. These small group cruises depart from the port around an hour and a half before sunset aboard elegant and comfortable sailing yachts. You‚Äôll first tour towards downtown, learning about the evolution of the city and the sites along the river via your entertaining and knowledgeable local guide, including cruising under Lisbon‚Äôs San Francisco-style bridge, then back perfectly in time to savor the incredible sunsets accompanied by some snacks and vinho verde.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: At Bel√©m Tower, you'll find yourself transported to a timeless realm where love flourishes. Its ancient walls whisper tales of bygone adventures, creating the perfect backdrop for your romantic escapade. Sharing an intimate moment with your beloved, you'll marvel at the breathtaking views of the Tagus River and the vast horizon.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

sources.snippet: Torre de Bel√©m is located on the shores of the Tagus River and can be reached via footbridge. The fortification was built to protect Lisbon from invaders, and it‚Äôs had many uses over the years. Belem Tower has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1983.
sources.shortName: 15x the best place to propose in Lisbon

sources.snippet: The Belem Tower is one of the most iconic landmarks in Lisbon, and it‚Äôs a popular spot for couples to visit. The views from the top are unforgettable, and it‚Äôs a great place to snap a romantic photo of the two of you. An added bonus: admission is free!
sources.shortName: 5 Most Romantic Places to Enjoy With Your Special Someone

sources.snippet: Enjoy a captivating journey along the Tagus River with a boat trip, showcasing iconic landmarks like Bel√©m Tower and the Discoveries Monument with stunning views.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

sources.snippet: After visiting the Jer√≥nimos Monastery**, the Bel√©m Tower* and the **Padr√£o dos Descobrimentos, head to the Jardim Tropical* for a romantic date walk.
sources.shortName: Our top 10 date romantic ideas for Lisbon

places.name: Bel√©m Tower

reviews.text: Great water castle, pity, that it's in reconctruction, so I could not get inside... pretty lovely. In my country castles were usually built up the hills, to see enemies. In fact, in my own city, we already have a monument to water castle.

Well unfortunately for us The Tower was wrapped in netting and had construction üöß work going on. Slight disappointment when we arrived. It's located 20 min from the city. Beautiful grounds and surrounding areas saying that. Well worth a visit if you're in the area, even if it's still wrapped up. The grounds are well maintained. They have a few eateries and amenities in the area too. This area can be very busy, as the Bel√©m Tower is one of the highlights of Lisbon. No idea when it will reopen and prices. A nice visit; although we didn't get to see what we wanted.
üí´

I am only knocking the stars down due to the tower being closed and covered in a scaffold. It is an amazing tower in a stunning location, but it currently looks like a building site. I believe it won't be reopened until mid-2026. I look forward to another trip to Lisbon to see it in all its glory

places.generalDescription: Jer√≥nimos Monastery, a stunning late Gothic Manueline-style monastery in Lisbon, offers a unique experience for visitors. The monastery houses archaeology and maritime museums in its wings, providing an opportunity to explore Portuguese history and maritime heritage. Families can enjoy medieval storytelling in the cloisters and visit the nearby Maritime Museum with its children's section and model ships. Adjacent to Belem Palace, expansive lawns offer space for picnics and outdoor activities.

sources.snippet: While the churches in Lisbon are beautiful, there‚Äôs something extra special, and extra romantic, about the Jer√≥nimos Monastery. Now a historic monument and classified as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the complex is a former monastery of the Order of Saint Jerome and one of the finest examples of Portuguese Late Gothic Manueline style. Although it‚Äôs very popular, there are plenty of quieter nooks and crannies to discover hand-in-hand with sweetheart.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: As you wander through the historic Jer√≥nimos Monastery in Lisbon, you'll find yourself wrapped in a timeless embrace of love's story. The intricate Gothic architecture, adorned with delicate carvings and elegant arches, sets the stage for your romantic adventure. Sharing a quiet moment with your beloved in the majestic cloisters or under the intricate rib-vaulted ceilings is like penning a new chapter in your love tale.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

sources.snippet: After visiting the Jer√≥nimos Monastery**, the Bel√©m Tower* and the **Padr√£o dos Descobrimentos, head to the Jardim Tropical* for a romantic date walk.
sources.shortName: Our top 10 date romantic ideas for Lisbon

sources.snippet: Landmarks like the iconic Bel√©m Tower and the majestic Jer√≥nimos Monastery exude a timeless charm, evoking a sense of wonder and admiration.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Jer√≥nimos Monastery

reviews.text:
Extremely busy- the queue was snaking for long. Worth coming really early or grabbing a bite to eat and exploring Belem before coming back in the afternoon. Much shorter wait after 2pm although still busy inside.
Beautiful, stunning architecture both from the outside and inside.

With a ticket from website, you still have to wait in a huge queue, so I don't understand the point of buying a ticket online. I think the best time to visit is around 13, when everyone is having lunch, so there will be a smaller queue.

The place is beautiful and very small, but it's not worth visiting because of the long line and the large number of people around‚Ä¶

I visited the Jer√≥nimos Monastery expecting detailed architecture and art, but nothing stood out. The tiles felt rushed and unfinished. The details inside looked sloppy. From the outside, the building is beautiful, but once you're inside there's not much to see. The visit is short and doesn't justify the 20 euro price.

On top of that, the online ticket system was slow and buggy. It took forever to load and wasn't clear during checkout. I ended up buying two tickets by mistake when I only needed one. What was already a bad deal got worse.

Compared to free museums in London that offer detailed art from all over the world, this felt empty and disappointing. You're better off looking at photos online. I don't recommend it. Spend your money elsewhere.

places.generalDescription: Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara is a captivating viewpoint in Lisbon, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city, including Alfama and Lisbon Castle. This urban park, located in the Bairro Alto district, provides a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle while still allowing visitors to admire its landmarks. The terraced garden features sculptures of Greek gods and goddesses, benches for relaxation, an ornamental fountain, and a charming outdoor cafe.

sources.snippet: In particular, the Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara in Bairro Alto is a scenic spot where terraced gardens and fountains add an extra charming appeal.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couples Guide To Lisbon

sources.snippet: This viewpoint offers a breathtaking panorama of Lisbon‚Äôs attractions and landmarks. Countless religious and other monuments, including Sao Jorge Castle, can be seen from there. This viewpoint features garden seating with a baroque fountain.Gloria‚Äôs Funicular is a popular way to reach the viewpoint, so it‚Äôs a good option if you would like to try also this attraction.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Romantic Things To Do In Lisbon With Your Sweetheart - Updated 2024

sources.snippet: Once to the top turn right and you‚Äôll reach the first of Lisbon‚Äôs famous viewpoints (or maradouro), the Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara, which offers a sprawling view of the twinkling downtown area and the golden castle.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: For a dash of romance, head to Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara, a gateway to a stroll through the Pr√≠ncipe Real district. Rest under the expansive canopy of a cedar tree in the Principe Real Garden.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Miradouro de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara

reviews.text: Visited on June 13th during the annual festival, and the atmosphere was electric! The viewpoint was buzzing with lively stalls selling refreshing drinks and delicious fast food. While I couldn't stay for the evening concert, the daytime energy alone was worth the trip. The panoramic views of Lisbon are breathtaking-you can see the entire city stretched out below, just as pictured. The charming fountain area offers plenty of seating, making it a perfect spot to relax with coffee or even enjoy a leisurely lunch. With ample benches and easy access via Tram 51E or local buses, this miradouro is both convenient and unforgettable. A must-visit for the views, vibes, and vibrant local culture!

We took the funicular up to this little park for the views, and it was not disappointing! The 270 degree views of the city and surrounding mountains were breathtaking.
There are two levels to this park, and plenty of park benches to relax on.
There is a small cafe here, if you need a drink or a snack.
I would definitely recommend visiting here, especially if you want some really great photos!

After taking the team to the top , or even walking (quite tiring but I tried the first time) you will definitely realize that it is definitely worth going up there. First of all
The view and the panoramic views of castle, the city are amazing. Later on you can go to the Barrio Alto and even spen sometime in the park by enjoying drinks and food. A must do.

places.address: R. de S√£o Pedro de Alc√¢ntara, 1250-238 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Parque Eduardo VII is a picturesque park in Lisbon, offering tree-lined paths, well-kept lawns, and stunning water views. The highest point of the park provides an unparalleled vista of Avenida da Liberdade and the River Tagus, offering a peaceful escape from the city center's hustle and bustle. Visitors can explore attractions like La Estufa Fria botanical gardens and The Amalia Rodrigues Garden dedicated to fado music.

sources.snippet: From Parque Eduardo VII, enjoy city views while having a lovely picnic in the park‚Äôs grassy field. I recommend grabbing sandwiches at the famous As Bifanas do Afonso, which serves delicious pork chop sandwiches. Then get some Past√©is de Nata, along with a few drinks.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 19 Extra Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon Portugal

sources.snippet: What‚Äôs more romantic than a couple‚Äôs picnic in a pretty park?. Parque Eduardo VII is located north of Lisbon‚Äôs high-end shopping street, Avenida da Liberdade. It‚Äôs a sprawling green space that offers a picturesque reprieve from the city‚Äôs more touristic areas.
sources.shortName: 15 Most Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon for Couples

sources.snippet: If you have a little more time left in your afternoon, you could then go for a stroll in the lovely Eduardo VII park, situated a short walk away.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: Eduardo VII Park

reviews.text: Who the hell is rating this place 4 stars? It's beautiful and picturesque üì∑ ü§≥.  Just go, don't listen to the fools. If you love walks and the outdoors I highly recommend hitting up this spot. You can take a bus to the top and walk down if you don't want to have a hard time; the slope is about 10¬∞ - lots of side parks on the way up.

It's a great place to walk in Center Lisbon. There are nice play ground upon its periphery. It's a great venue for seasonal festivals as well. The Park contains notable fountains and sculptures too, as well as the iconic Lisbon installation with view of the harbor in the distance.

It is a beautiful public park in Lisbon, Portugal. The park occupies an area of 26 hectares (64 acres). The park was built in the first half of the 20th century to restore public green space. The park's central strip, covered with grass, is flanked by long Portuguese paved walkways. The park is at a gradient from the top observation deck you can see it well. Well manicured lawns and hedges. The top of the park is a has the Monument to the Carnation Revolution, flanked by two sets of two obelisks. Car park nearby and easy walk to observation deck. Wear comfy shoes, take water, wear hat, sunscreen. Great place for photography

places.generalDescription: The Calouste Gulbenkian Museum, located in Lisbon, is part of a foundation established by philanthropist Calouste Gulbenkian. The museum boasts an extensive collection of over six thousand works spanning from antiquity to the early 20th century, including pieces by renowned artists such as Manet, Degas, Renoir and Monet. Additionally, the museum houses art from various cultures including ancient Egypt, Mesopotamia and the Qing dynasty.

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs a few short blocks away from the lovely Museum of Calouste Gulbenkian, an Armenian oil billionaire who chose Lisbon as the home of his impressive art collection. Located in two specifically designed modern buildings, The Founder‚Äôs Collection traces the history of art from the Egyptian to 20th century Modernists and features masterpieces by the likes of Rembrandt, Turner and Degas whereas the Modern Collection introduces visitors to modern and contemporary Portuguese art. After your visit you can contemplate the art you saw in the pretty garden which encircles it.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: Calouste Gulbenkian Museum

reviews.text: Interesting museum with an older building and a brand new one. Architecture of both is interesting. The landscape/gardens surrounding the museum(s) is very inviting. Tranquil place in a bustling city. Gardens open to the public

Unfortunately, the museum is temporarily closed. Yet, they have several exhibitions, including the main items like masterpieces from the main collections! Such as art pieces from Ottoman Empire, Iran, Asian arts, and European (mostly French in my opinion). The collection was amazing! I am so happy that they still offer temporary exhibitions even during the maintenance.

Petrol money put to good use. It's sad to see so many new structures talking over the once amazing gardens. Still beautiful but the new buildings are not welcome and even the new wood structure is just a waste of money and garden space. Gulbenkian will remain a very special space in Lisbon.

places.generalDescription: Miradouro da Gra√ßa is a must-visit terrace in Lisbon, offering stunning panoramic views of the city rooftops and the surrounding waters. It provides an incredible vantage point to admire Sao Jorge Castle, the river, Mouraria district, and downtown Baixa Pombalina. Accessible via the 28 tram, this viewpoint is praised as one of the most beautiful in Lisbon.

sources.snippet: The official name of this view is Miradouro Sophia de Mello Breyner Andresen but more often is called Miradouro de Gra√ßa. Sophia Andresen was a poet who spent a lot of time near this overlook, which she found inspiring for her work. There is a bronze bust here that was even included in one of her Portuguese poems.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Romantic Things To Do In Lisbon With Your Sweetheart - Updated 2024

places.name: Miradouro da Gra√ßa

reviews.text: I've been to Lisbon 3 times now and stayed for 2 weeks this trip & this is by far my FAVORITE VIEWPOINT! We've gone back multiple times this trip and it's especially good at sunset. There's a cafe/bar that overlooks the city but also plenty of other seating around. There's often someone playing music which elevates the vibe too. Highly recommend anytime of day! The best panoramic view of Lisbon for me.

Stunning viewpoint!! Very easy to reach here from different points of the city center. I would recommend at first starting from Santa Apolonia to visit Alfama, and from there it's not even 10 minutes. Later, you can also visit the Castle given that it's pretty close too.
Possible to easily spot on historical landmarks from this miradouro. Lots of cafes and bars are nearby, if you would like to.

I walked up via the road which is very steep and walked down via the steps. There is also a funicular that connect to the bottom. Views are incredible. The church was open and it's free to enter. There is a bar with seating for drink and think they also serve snacks.
I definitely recommend the visit.

places.generalDescription: The Carmo Archaeological Museum is a must-see site in Lisbon, Portugal. It was once the largest church in the city but was heavily damaged during the 1755 earthquake and now stands as a powerful reminder of that historic event. The ruined Gothic church, built between 1389 and 1423, features an evocative roofless nave and houses a museum.

sources.snippet: Be sure to make a stop at the city‚Äôs soaring medieval cathedral, dating back to the 1100s and survivor of the Lisbon‚Äôs devastating earthquakes‚Ä¶ another must-see site for a romantic visit, and your next stop, by either the tram or criss-crossing downtown, is the breath-taking ruins of the Carmo Convent and Church. Once the largest church in Lisbon, this lovely gothic structure was too heavily damaged during the infamous 1755 earthquake to be rebuilt. It‚Äôs a powerful reminder to this important event in the city‚Äôs history and a mysterious site to visit.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: Carmo Archaeological Museum

reviews.text:
We decided to come here because of the cat. In fact the cat even has souvenirs!

The museum itself is quite stunning both the damaged part and the intact part.

The cost is 7 euros for adults and it was a great experience to learn more about history and even see some mummies. All of the specimens from different ages are very well preserved :)

A unique and different place to visit, traditional there would be a roof on this place but due to the interesting story behind it they never rebuilt it. It was a great day outside so the whole experience was great and nice, the toilets were clean and accessible. The staff were nice and friendly. The history behind this place and the things to see make this place a must to see.

Well worth a visit. 7 euros per person takes you inside. It is absolutely stunning. Very clever way of explaining the whole history is a film that runs inside in English and Portuguese. You can just walk in and leave as you please. Displays inside is beautiful and very well marked and description is well put out. We got there around 2pm, and it was busy but not overly busy

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hilltop overlooking the city, Castelo de S√£o Jorge is an 11th-century Moorish castle and former royal residence. Visitors can explore palace ruins and an archaeological museum within its walls. The castle offers panoramic views of Lisbon and is a popular tourist attraction in the historic Alfama district. Kids will enjoy racing around the ramparts, sitting on giant cannons, and using periscopes to observe daily life in the city below.

sources.snippet: Lisbon's historic S√£o Jorge Castle offers an enchanting experience for couples seeking a passionate retreat. As you wander along the ancient walls, you'll find yourself lost in time, surrounded by breathtaking vistas that set the scene for whispered sweet nothings. The castle's historical charm, with its cobbled paths and dramatic overlooks, makes it the perfect backdrop for stolen kisses and dreamy moments.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

sources.snippet: Getting on here will better your chances of having a seat as you jiggle up through Alfama, one of the oldest districts of the city and to the S√£o Jorge castle. Lisbon‚Äôs castle is a must for any romantic visit to the city. While much of it is reconstructed, exploring its towers and hidden corners is part of the fun.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: **Imagine yourselves king and queen of your very own castle with a visit to Castelo de S√£o Jorge, located atop one of Lisbon‚Äôs famous hills. One for both history lovers and romantics, this historic site has artefacts dating back to the 11th century, turrets, views and of course a caf√©.
sources.shortName: Seven Quirky Date Night Ideas in Lisbon | Destination Guides

sources.snippet: Castelo Sao Jorge is, therefore, a stunning location for a surprise proposal. You have amazing views over Lisbon and the Tagus River from the terrace. The moment just before sunset is just magical here!
sources.shortName: 15x the best place to propose in Lisbon

sources.snippet: After having breakfast, head to the Castelo S√£o Jorge to enjoy one of the most incredible views of the city while the city wakes up.
sources.shortName: Our top 10 date romantic ideas for Lisbon

places.name: Castelo de S√£o Jorge

reviews.text:
This place is amazing! First of all if you are under 25 you pay less to get in so this is very nice of them. There are beautiful peacocks almost everywhere with their cute little peacock babies following them. The view is stunning and you have a lot of good view points all around the castle. Overall it's full of nature, history and beauty. It was one of the most beautiful attractions in Lisbon.

We highly recommend!

Wonderful castle, very well preserved. It's quite big, so there is a lot to explore and the best, the view over the city of Lisbon is just magnificent. Especially the old town, where you can see the architecture.
There is a community of peacocks living in the castle, they are very adorable and not afraid of the tourist.
It's really worth the visit, to get a panoramic view of the city.
Highly recommended.

Completely worth the visit!! We bought tickets online to avoid the line. The views were stunning and the ruins were totally worth the walk through. There were gorgeous peacocks all over the property and even some babies! Bathrooms were clean and taken care of (though there was a bit of a line). We went with kids 10-13 and they also had a lovely time. The neighborhood right outside the castle is also lovely, with live music and lots of interesting places to eat and shop. Would definitely recommend adding this to the itinerary!

places.address: R. de Santa Cruz do Castelo, 1100-129 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the lush expanse of Parque Eduardo VII, Estufa Fria is a captivating greenhouse that offers visitors an enchanting escape into nature right in the heart of Lisbon. This botanical haven showcases a stunning array of exotic plants, beautifully arranged across three distinct greenhouses, each mimicking different climates to support diverse flora. As you wander through this verdant paradise, you'll encounter mesmerizing waterfalls and charming statues that enhance its serene ambiance.

sources.shortName: 5 Romantic places in Lisbon for Valentine's Day!

places.name: Estufa Fria

reviews.text: This botanical garden is a true gem, offering a diverse collection of plants.  The layout is well-designed, creating a tranquil and relaxing atmosphere.  There are numerous benches and open spaces, perfect for enjoying a picnic lunch.  The affordable 3 euro entrance fee makes it an exceptional value.  A visit here is highly recommended for anyone seeking a peaceful escape.  The variety of flora provides something of interest for every visitor.  It's a wonderful place to spend a few hours immersed in nature.

Really nice and super cheap. Cool plants and I saw baby ducks! there are so many rooms and pathways, despite it not being the biggest building in the world you really feel like you can get lost in there. Very thoughtfully and beautifully designed.

Verry beautiful, if you are traveling to Lisbon or just live here, I would recommend coming here. It's very beautiful nature in the middle of the city come here and relax and enjoy your day. also, if you are a student or a younger person, you can get tickets for way cheaper. You just need to show your student card confirmation that you are a student and we paid our tickets for five euros the two of us so that's amazing.

places.generalDescription: Miradouro das Portas do Sol is a popular scenic viewpoint in Lisbon, offering panoramic views of traditional Alfama houses with red roofs and churches. From this vantage point, visitors can take in the National Pantheon, the Tagus River, and the 17th-century Sao Vicente de Fora Church. The area features a cafe and bar where guests can enjoy various drinks and snack/lunch items while basking in the sunny skies and surrounding palm trees.

sources.snippet: Start your day with a romantic stroll through the winding streets and end it watching the sunset from one of the viewpoints in the area, such as Miradouro das Portas do Sol or Miradouro da Senhora do Monte. The panoramic view of the Tagus River is simply breathtaking. Immerse yourself in the city at dusk with a sunset walk* and treat yourself to an intimate traditional dinner accompanied by an exciting live Fado* performance.
sources.siteName: Living Tours - Tours and Activities in Portugal and Spain
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon, 2025

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre lodging in the Alfama district‚Äîbe it at the Memmo Alfama, Santiago de Alfama, Convento do Salvador, Solar do Castelo, or Solar dos Mouros‚Äîyou‚Äôre just a stone‚Äôs throw away.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Miradouro das Portas do Sol

reviews.text: Completely free viewpoint! Yet, there are tons of cafes and bars nearby, so you can still enjoy the view with a drink or a meal. This miradouro is located in the middle of many historical landmarks, so you can also walk around more and visit Pantheon or other viewpoint sites as well!

Amazing view! It's a short walk out to the view and when we were there, aggressive sales people acted friendly and gave "gifts" on the way in, but then got aggressive on the way out when I refused to buy the bracelet. Just be aware.
Astonishing view over the Lisbon. Many things to notice and enjoy. Usually full of curious people. However, everyone will find the spot to observe üòåüå∏

places.address: Largo Portas do Sol, 1100-411 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Located between the Tagus River and the Jeronimos Monastery, Centro Cultural de Bel√©m is a contemporary venue built in the 1980s. Crafted from pink marble, it was initially designed as the headquarters for the Portuguese presidency of the European Community. However, it has since transformed into a cultural center offering diverse artistic experiences including concerts, opera, ballet, and exhibitions.

sources.snippet: You can also visit the Centro Cultural Belem (CCB) for your daily dose of art and get lost in its gardens. Or why don‚Äôt you take your date to the moon by visiting the Planetarium Calouste Gulbenkian!. Does it get any more romantic than that?
sources.shortName: 7 Original Date Ideas in Lisbon

places.name: Centro Cultural de Bel√©m

reviews.text:
This was the perfect bathroom break between the monastery and the Belem Tower.
Very contemporary building.
Really not my kind of art, but this place is built like  a tank or bunker.

I totally recommend a visit to the cultural centre and its exhibitions, I go often and never cease to be entertained. It's all great, the location along the riverside, the history of Bel√©m neighbourhood, the amazing architecture and its high standards exhibitions, with excellent services, caf√©s, theatre, restaurants and paid parking underneath. A gem in Lisbon.
Very nice place, with some cool modern  art. About 20 min from city center with an uber. We walked back along the river. Totally ok, if you are used to walking:-)

places.generalDescription: Cervejaria Ramiro is a bustling seafood and beer spot that has been around since the 1950s. It's a popular haunt for both locals and tourists, with queues often stretching down the street. The restaurant gained international attention when Anthony Bourdain featured it on his show, No Reservations. Despite its name, Cervejaria Ramiro is renowned for its exceptional seafood offerings such as lobster, prawns, crab, clams cooked in olive oil and garlic, and more.

sources.snippet: Ask any local where to get one of the best seafood meals and chances are that they‚Äôll point you to one place: Cervejaria Ramiro.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon, Portugal

places.name: Cervejaria Ramiro

reviews.text:
This was one of the best meals we had in Lisbon! It was so worth the price and the seafood were all so fresh.

We got their Barnacles, their snow crab with sauce, Carabineiro, clams, scampi, and their prego. The Barnacles was nice and briny, similiar to clams or mussels. The steamed scampi was overcooked until almost shredded. But the real show was really the crab. The crab was filled with fresh meat. We love the way they made the crab sauce with the crab head, and it was the perfect dipping sauce.

The vibe at the restaurant was fun and relaxed, and the staff were friendly. Definitely a spot I'd come back to whenever I'm in town. Highly recommend if you love good seafood!

If you want to come here, definitely make a reservation because this spot gets packed and your 25‚Ç¨ deposit is applied to your bill in the end too!

10/10 would recommend this spot if you love fresh and delicious seafood!

Booked online, so no need to wait.
The seafood is really fresh. Not fishy at all.
Highly recommend the scarlet prawn. Fresh and bouncy shrimp meat.
The edible crab is also amazing. Rich in flavor and has huge claws.
The bread with butter is crispy outside and soft in the middle. It tastes even better with the sauce from the food.
The clams and scallops are great as well.
The service is good, and the atmosphere is good. Highly recommend.

seafood are super fresh, bread tastes good with strong butter. no wonder it's crowded. recommend trying dish with different cooking method

we didn't book table in advanced, waited for an hour, around 40 tables before us when we arrived at 8pm. luckily there is a lounge area for waiting where you can get a drink or sit there.

places.address: Av. Alm. Reis 1 H, 1150-007 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The Basilica of Estrela, located in the Estrela district of western Lisbon, is an impressive late 18th-century church known for its ornate Baroque architecture. The church features twin bell towers and a vast dome, with a stunning interior adorned with multi-colored marble in shades of pink, yellow, and gray. It houses the tomb of Queen Maria I, who commissioned the basilica to honor the safe delivery of her son.

sources.snippet: At Estrela Basilica, you'll find an enchanting world of architectural elegance that will sweep you off your feet. With its grand facade and ornate interior, this place oozes romance. The soft, warm light filtering through stained glass windows creates an intimate atmosphere, making it the perfect spot for couples.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

places.name: Basilica of Estrela

reviews.text: It is an absolute must see! One of the prettiest Basilicas we've visited. And we were able to access the roof and walk around the inside of the church from above and look down into the sanctuary. Absolutely gorgeous!
One of fav places in Lisbon. Very intricate details of the dome and arches. A must-visit spot for the  moment of peace and awe. Highly recommend spending time here to soak in serenity.
A basilica and a national heritage of Portugal. Built around 1780 this is the first church dedicated to the Sacred Heart of Jesus. It is very good and the dome above the altar is wonderful.

places.address: Bas√≠lica da Estrela, Pra√ßa da Estrela 12, 1200-667 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Cais das Colunas is a stunning late 18th-century quay that beautifully frames the Tagus River with its two elegant columns and marble steps. This picturesque spot, known for its breathtaking sunset views, has been lovingly restored to reflect its original charm using 400 stones. As you stroll along this iconic riverside area, you'll find it hard not to be captivated by the romantic ambiance created by the shimmering city lights reflecting on the water.

sources.snippet: Is there a more romantic setting in Lisbon than the Tagus illuminated by the city lights?. The answer is in the Namoradeiras of Cais das Colunas, an iconic riverside wall rebuilt to restore its original design, using 400 stones. This icon of Lisbon's heritage returned to Terreiro do Pa√ßo to revive the memory of many and to fall in love with others, since anyone who passes by doesn't pass by without falling in love.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic places in Lisbon for Valentine's Day!

sources.snippet: While Bel√©m provides a prime vantage point, locations like Ribeira das Naus and Cais das Colunas near Comercio Square also promise breathtaking sunset views.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Cais das Colunas

reviews.text: It was a lovely day for a walk, and this was a lovely place to visit! There is only a small sandy beach area, but it was fairly clean and our little dog absolutely loved running around on the sand after walking on pavement all day! (we didn't see any signs saying that dogs are not allowed on the beach and we kept her on a leash).

Cais das Colunas is one of those places in Lisbon that just sticks with you. Tucked right next to Pra√ßa do Com√©rcio, it's a peaceful riverside spot with amazing views of the Tagus-especially at sunset. Whether you're passing through or looking for a place to unwind, this is a perfect stop.

The vibe here is really special. It's calm but still full of life-locals lounging around, tourists soaking it all in, occasional street performers, and sometimes even live music playing in the background. It feels like a snapshot of Lisbon's soul.

I love grabbing a coffee and just sitting on the stone steps, watching boats go by and the sky change colors as the city lights start to glow. It's also a great spot for photos-between the water reflections and the beautiful architecture, everything looks picture-perfect.

It's simple, free, and yet one of the most memorable parts of the city. I've been here multiple times and always end up staying longer than I planned.

If you're visiting Lisbon, definitely carve out a little time to come here. You won't regret it.

The view of the Tagus River, the 25th of April Bridge, and the view is simply breathtaking, especially at sunset. It's a great spot to sit, take photos, and soak in the city's atmosphere. A must-see for anyone exploring the Pra√ßa do Com√©rcio area

places.generalDescription: MAAT - Museum of Art, Architecture and Technology is located in an old riverside power station in Lisbon. The museum showcases contemporary art from renowned artists like Stefan Sagmeister and Joana Vasconcelos. It occupies both the former power plant and a new building designed by architect Amanda Levete. The museum offers a stunning view over the Tagus River and the city, especially at sunset.

sources.snippet: You can chill near the riverside or go up to its roof for the best view. And if you‚Äôre still in Bel√©m in time for dinner, Este Oeste is always a good choice.
sources.shortName: 7 Original Date Ideas in Lisbon

places.name: MAAT - Museum of Art, Architecture and Technology

reviews.text: I must be completely transparent, I did not visit the interior exhibits. However as a lifetime architecture student and admirer the exterior is worth a visit - come down to the Tagus for sunrise or sunset to see the city and it locals bathed in a golden glow. I cannot think of a grander modern esplanade.  Additionally the MAAT Cafe & Kitchen has unrivaled views and impeccable  interior design.

The museum was worth the money, coming from Vancouver and seeing the photos by Jeff Wall was interesting, as they were taken from my hometown. I enjoyed the new perspectives that this museum has to offer, and a look into the energy exhibit. Some of the art was hard to comprehend, but after reading the captions it started to make sense.

I think the point of this museum is to make you think hard-about humanity and the world in general. It's worth a visit.

We went up on the roof and the views were stunning. There's a great view of the bridge, and the surrounding water.

Would recommend!

This place was overpriced and frankly boring on the inside. The worst museum that I have been too.  One part is an art exhibit which was some guys photos that were very staged.  It didn't really grab me and the other was an energy building that also had a very disturbing art exhibit. The last part of the energy was interesting but  that couldn't make up for the large displacement the rest of this was.

The plus side for the place was the exterior of the building. Amazing architecture and a beautiful patio with a view.

Go check out the interior but save your money on the inside.

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Contemporary Art ‚Äì MAC/CCB, located in one of Lisbon's historic districts, is a modern and contemporary art museum that underwent renovation and rebranding. It features a collection including works by renowned artists such as Picasso, Bacon, and Warhol, along with temporary exhibitions. The spacious galleries house a diverse range of art from the origins of modernism to late-20th-century avant-gardism.

sources.snippet: You can also visit the Centro Cultural Belem (CCB) for your daily dose of art and get lost in its gardens. Or why don‚Äôt you take your date to the moon by visiting the Planetarium Calouste Gulbenkian!. Does it get any more romantic than that?
sources.shortName: 7 Original Date Ideas in Lisbon

places.name: Museum of Contemporary Art ‚Äì MAC/CCB

reviews.text: A world-class journey through modern and contemporary art, curated with vision. The Berardo Collection brings together iconic works from the 20th and 21st centuries - from Picasso and Dal√≠ to Warhol and Hockney - alongside thought-provoking pieces by Portuguese and international artists. The layout flows chronologically and thematically, making it easy to connect movements, ideas, and styles. Spacious galleries, clear signage, and temporary exhibitions keep the experience fresh for repeat visits. Whether you're an art lover or a curious first-timer, this is one of Lisbon's cultural treasures - and a testament to Jos√© Berardo's commitment to sharing art with the public.

The Museum is definitely interesting, but if you're not really into modern art, it can feel like just a bunch of oddly placed objects, paintings and strange photos. Some pieces are cool and really make you think, while others just leave you confused. It's a fun place to wander around - as long as you keep an open mind. A very open mind. Unfortunately, mine isn't quite open enough to fully appreciate all those objects.

The CCB Museum is a must when visiting Lisbon. The building itself is impressive, with modern architecture that blends beautifully into the city's riverside. Inside, the collections are carefully curated and the temporary exhibitions bring a fresh and engaging perspective every time. The space feels open, inviting, and inspiring, perfect for both art lovers and casual visitors. A cultural landmark that shows Lisbon at its most contemporary and creative.

places.generalDescription: Pens√£o Amor is a unique bar located in Lisbon's old Red Light District, offering a vintage-inspired ambiance that pays homage to its former use as a cheap guesthouse. The five floors of this former brothel are decorated with saucy objects, burlesque posters, and mirrors, creating an atmosphere reminiscent of the old boudoir. The venue features an erotica book store and even offers pole dancing lessons.

sources.snippet: Or finish your stay in Lisbon at the grungy yet sexy Pensao Amor. A repurposed derelict boarding house, the ‚Äúthink love‚Äù of its name is exuded in many forms throughout this bordello vibe venue. The different rooms have different ambiances, from the maison close cocktail lounge, the the poll-dance disco-tech with racy art work, the place will certainly add a dash of naughtiness.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: Pens√£o Amor

reviews.text:
Probably one of the best bars in the city. Stunning, unique atmosphere and ambient. Wonderful crowd. Good location. Prices quite high and drinks not so unique or tasty. Not expertly crafted cocktails. Rather traditional classics.
The big downside was service. Random, inexperienced young people. They didn't have any customer service skills or knowledge, so unless you don't know yourself what you like I wouldn't recommend. Quite shocked us when one of the waitresses spilled whole entire tray of drinks straight onto young foreign customers sitting by one of the tables next to us! What kind of service is it?

A very interesting baroque themed bar with a leaning towards the burlesque/brothel vibe. Not what you expect to stumble upon! I was there early afternoon and there were only a couple of people knocking around. I'd imagine the later the better!

One of the best bars with character that I've been to ever! Walked in solo on a Sunday evening around 930pm and was lucky to find a table. Amazing ambience and friendly staff. The vibe, the feel, the drinks - all fantastic. Had 3 cocktails and thoroughly enjoyed all of em. V reasonably priced drinks overall.
The place got quite busy post 11.

Oh and make sure to go down to the loo ;) it has a vibe and character of it's own - which adds to the overall experience

I wasn't aware of the "rules" of the bar as such (walked in with a waterbottle in my hand ) ; but the way the staff handled it and explained it to me was extremely professional and yet v friendly.

They don't have any food, but the staff was kind enough to suggest a brilliant burger joint closeby.

Highly recommend a visit if in Lisbon.

places.generalDescription: The Vasco da Gama Tower, also known as Torre Vasco da Gama, is a striking 145-meter-high nautical sail-shaped tower located in Parque das Nacoes, Lisbon. Originally designed as an observation deck for the World Expo 1998, it was later transformed into a luxury hotel. The tower offers panoramic elevators that take visitors to Babylon 360, an observation platform providing stunning 360-degree views of Lisbon and the Tagus River.

sources.snippet: As you advance, the Vasco da Gama Tower and Bridge grace your path, offering numerous spots to pause, relax, and soak in panoramic vistas.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon: A Journey of Love

places.name: Vasco da Gama Tower Babylon 360

reviews.text:
Amazing Bar.
The view.. the environment.. we'll the prices are according to the place.
Very good to have a drink in a calm environment.  Good for business and also for romantic dates.
If you look for a great place to start the night, I really recommend this one.

Excellent place to enjoy the sunset view. It's around 145m tall. There is a bar on the top and you can enjoy 360 degree view of Lisbon. If it is during sunset it could become a bit crowded. There are seats and sofa to sit an enjoy the view.

Vasco da Gama Tower ‚Äì Babylon 360 Sky Bar

Babylon 360, located at the top of the Vasco da Gama Tower in Lisbon, is an unforgettable spot that combines breathtaking views with a stylish bar experience.

The panoramic view is absolutely stunning-from up here you can admire the Tagus River, the Vasco da Gama Bridge stretching endlessly across the water, and the modern skyline of Parque das Na√ß√µes. Watching the sunset from this vantage point is truly magical and makes the visit worth it on its own.

The bar itself is modern, chic, and elegant, with a relaxed yet sophisticated vibe. It's designed to let the views shine, with floor-to-ceiling windows that make you feel as if you're floating above the city.

The drinks menu is excellent, offering a wide selection of cocktails, wines, and spirits. The cocktails are creative, well-balanced, and beautifully presented, perfectly matching the high-end feel of the venue. Prices are naturally a bit higher than average for Lisbon, but considering the location and experience, they feel justified.

The service is professional and attentive, with staff who are friendly and quick to offer recommendations. You never feel rushed, and the overall pace of the evening allows you to fully enjoy the atmosphere.

Whether you're looking for a romantic evening, a special occasion spot, or simply one of the best views in Lisbon, Babylon 360 delivers. It's not just a bar, it's an experience that combines stunning scenery, quality drinks, and excellent service.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Lisbon who wants to enjoy the city from a whole new perspective.

places.address: R. Cais das Naus 2 21.01, 1990-173 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: The National Pantheon, also known as Igreja de Santa Engracia, is a 17th-century baroque church in Lisbon that has been transformed into a modern mausoleum for national celebrities. Originally founded in the 12th century by King Afonso Henriques, it was dedicated to Saint Vincent of Saragossa and later became a place for the tombs of Portugal's rich and famous.

sources.snippet: These trips, which last around two hours, also offer a view of Lisbon‚Äôs most popular landmarks from a different angle, including the bright Pra√ßa do Com√©rcio square, the dome of the National Pantheon, the 25 de Abril bridge, and the Bel√©m Tower.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Couples Guide To Lisbon

places.name: National Pantheon

reviews.text:
Though smaller than other national pantheons I've visited, Lisbon's National Pantheon is exceptionally well-maintained and offers a distinct charm all its own. What stood out most was the integration of contemporary artistic collaborations, which breathe new life into the space without overshadowing its historical weight.

The structure itself is elegant and serene, and the modern touches serve as a powerful reminder of how history and memory continue to evolve. It's a quiet, reflective place-less grandiose, but deeply intentional in its presentation.

A meaningful stop for those who appreciate heritage spaces that honour the past while embracing the present.

Even though I have the utmost respect for this place, I cannot shake the feeling that there's something wrong. It does honor important Portuguese figures who shouldered the foundations of the country and state next to a soccer player. Weren't there more people to celebrate for their courage against state enemies? Artists that created lasting cultural shifts like fado (there's one)? The history of the place is where it hits home, and I recommend you read about it and visit it for its charm rather than for most of the resting souls it hosts. The terrace is also a thing, if you like stunning views of roofs and the port.

American Traveler here. We stumbled upon this place as we were at a Saturday flea market. I thought the outside architecture was beautiful. I loved the curves and sharpness. Even on a Saturday the wait time was a little long. They only allowed a certain amount of people in at a time. The gift shop was closed at the time. Absolutely beautiful inside and if you go upstairs you have a great view of the city. A must see!

places.address: Campo de Santa Clara, 1100-471 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Portugal, Alma is a high-end dining destination that truly embodies the essence of culinary artistry. Under the expert guidance of renowned chef Henrique Sa Pessoa, this restaurant offers an innovative menu that beautifully marries traditional Portuguese flavors with global influences. The name "Alma," meaning "soul" in Portuguese, reflects its commitment to soulful cooking and exceptional dining experiences. At Alma, guests are treated to a gastronomic journey through Portugal's rich culinary landscape.

sources.snippet: At Alma, you will find an informal author's menu, but full of flavour and with a strong traditional Portuguese signature. It is the perfect place for a romantic dinner in Lisbon, especially if you want to relax in a sophisticated atmosphere, while letting yourself be seduced by a cuisine that the chef himself defines as ‚Äòrefined taste with a perfect technique and that presents an excellent product‚Äô.
sources.shortName: Restaurants for a romantic dinner in Lisbon

places.name: Alma

reviews.text:
Simply amazing!
One of the best meals I have had in my life.

I had the ‚ÄòCosta a Costa' tasting menu that focus on fish and seafood.

Although the menu comprises 6 dishes, there's like 5 or 6 dishes before the tasting starts.

All the staff was great, very friendly and professional.

The atmosphere is very nice. Relaxed, modern and not too pretentious.

It was my wife's birthday, we even got a small cake with candles!

This is not a cheap restaurant, but you can't buy the quality of the food served in this restaurant nor the two michelin stars it rightfully deserves.

I wish I was rich, I would go there every week!

You must go try it for yourself!

I asked for the vegetarian tasting experience, which is an option available upon request even if off-menu. I was not disappointed at all! everything worked out really well. The food is really interesting and intriguing, it's a restaurant worth the hype. One dowside to mention is the noise : there are many tables is a small space, the room is not soundproof. I recommend booking around 21:00 as people will start to leave and the restaurant will get more quiet. I appreciated the staff mentioning that tips are not mandatory , its the first time I have been to a high end restaurant that made sure to communicate this aspect to their customers, so at the end I was more than happy to pay for it anyways!

I had the tasting menu with wine pairing, and it was an exceptional experience. The wine pairings were spot on, perfectly complementing each dish. Duarte, the host, was absolutely brilliant-he explained everything with such care and detail, making my solo dining experience feel truly amazing. The standout dishes for me were the stuffed squid and the turbot, both beautifully prepared and flavorful.

places.generalDescription: A Ginjinha is a historic open-fronted bar located in Praca de Sao Domingos, Lisbon. It holds the distinction of being the first place in the city to sell Ginjinha, a local cherry-like liqueur. The bar was established in 1840 by Francisco Espinheira, who was advised by a friar to infuse ginja berries in Portuguese brandy along with sugar, water, and cinnamon.

sources.snippet: Get a shot at the historic A Ginjinha, in business since 1840, this tiny shop sells shots of their choice of ginja to local regulars and locals alike. The Praza de S√£o Domimgos, were the itsy-bitsy bar is found, can sometimes be abuzz in the evenings with buskers. Either way it‚Äôs good for people watching, so you can sip your shot here or instead, you can compare with its competitor, my favorite of the two, Ginjinha Sem Rival, meaning ‚Äúwithout rival,‚Äù around 2o meters up R.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

places.name: A Ginjinha

reviews.text: Small place, big tradition! Cheap, tasty cherry liqueur - a classic Lisbon experience. Just grab a shot and enjoy.

Sticky floors! sticky floors! sticky floors
Saturday 8:45PM. There was a bit of a queue but service was fast. Mix client√®le but mostly tourists. Had 2 shots. Love this cherry sour Portugese liquor.
I prefer the other Ginjinha store nearby though.

The best in town! This liqueur, served in shot glasses with 2 or 3 cherries inside, is definitely a must-try here. The fruit tastes quite alcoholic at first bite, but then turns sweet and leaves a pleasant aftertaste. By the way, the cherries have pits, so bite carefully!

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Lisbon, the Teatro Nacional de S√£o Carlos is a stunning 18th-century opera house that showcases a beautiful neoclassical design. Constructed between 1792 and 1795, it stands as one of the city's most cherished landmarks and was inspired by Milan's La Scala.

sources.snippet: For a fancy night out in Lisbon, you and your loved one can spend the night at the prestigious Portuguese theatre, Teatro S√£o Carlos. Constructed in the late 18th century, the building‚Äôs magnificent neoclassical architecture can charm any couple that decides to visit its vast halls. The theatre is home to the country‚Äôs most spectacular opera and ballet performances.
sources.shortName: 6 Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon in 2024

sources.snippet: Teatro Nacional de S√£o Carlos is the main opera house in Lisbon, opened in 1793. Its interior is stunning and feels like something out of a fairytale. Here, you and your partner will experience a romantic night of beautiful singing and maybe even some dancing.
sources.siteName: Hill City Bride | Virginia Wedding Blog
sources.shortName: 19 Extra Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon Portugal
Our top 10 date romantic ideas for Lisbon
Seven Quirky Date Night Ideas in Lisbon | Destination Guides

places.name: Teatro Nacional de S√£o Carlos

reviews.text:
Very old authentic theatre with great condition.
Beware, there's no buffet there!
The cabins on the second & third floor are really great!

tonight, together with many other people, we waited for an hour outside the Academy of Sciences to attend the Guerra concert scheduled in the library, which until yesterday was certainly included in the program on the official website of the Theatre. It is shameful that an important musical institution suddenly cancels a concert, even if it is free, without replacing it or informing it in time and simply making it disappear from the site. the lack of attention and respect for the public (who could have done something else instead of wasting time, like us who came on purpose by train from Cascais) as well as minimal programming, make us evaluate this Theater as the poorest in Europe
Beautiful theater, built in just 6 months. There is not a bad seat here.

places.generalDescription: Tram 28 in Lisbon is a historical experience, taking riders through the city's most impressive streets and neighborhoods. This classic yellow tram, with its original 1930s features like brass dials and polished wood interiors, offers a charming way to explore the city. Starting from Praca Martim Moniz Square, it traverses famous routes showcasing top sights from Baixa to Graca and Estrela.

sources.snippet: To really experience Lisbon in a novel and romantic fashion, hop on board the number 28 tram. These bright yellow streetcars shake, rattle and roll their way over the city's most picturesque neighbourhoods to follow a meandering track past monuments, museums and miradouros (viewpoints). The tram connects Martim Moniz in the Baixa (downtown) district with Campo Ourique, an area west of the city centre.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Things to Do in Lisbon

sources.snippet: From here, you only a couple of short blocks from Martim Moniz square and the start of the city‚Äôs most famous streetcar, the rickety Tram 28. Getting on here will better your chances of having a seat as you jiggle up through Alfama, one of the oldest districts of the city and to the S√£o Jorge castle. Lisbon‚Äôs castle is a must for any romantic visit to the city.
sources.shortName: A Romantic Weekend in Lisbon

sources.snippet: Imagine you and your partner embarking on a delightful journey through Lisbon, hand in hand, aboard the iconic Tram 28. This vintage tram ride, winding through the charming streets of the city, creates a cosy atmosphere. The cobbled roads beneath you tell tales of history, and the quaint neighbourhoods pass by like scenes from a romantic movie.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Romantic Places In Lisbon For Couples you Must Visit 2024

places.name: Tram 28

reviews.text: The tram is fun and worth it. If you go early you can get in the cue early and have a seat. We did and it was worth it. We sat through the entire journey watching the locals hop on and off as they clung on to the sides of the moving trams. It's a fantastic way to see a good part of the city that is hills and more hills without having to manage walking them.

A Unique Experience Not to Be Missed!

We arrived at the tram stop shortly after 10 a.m. and found a long queue already forming. After waiting for about an hour and a half, we finally boarded around 11:30 a.m. Although the wait was long, it was absolutely worth it!

Riding the tram through the narrow, winding streets of Lisbon is a one-of-a-kind experience. Videos don't do it justice-you truly have to be on the tram to feel the charm and excitement for yourself. It's a fun and unforgettable way to see the city!

A must-see in Lisbon is a ride on tram 28, which runs right through the city and especially through the famous Alfama neighbourhood.
There's just one thing you should be careful of: don't stick your head or your mobile phone too far out of the window, because sometimes it's really less than 30 cm to the next traffic sign, building fence or house facade.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Lisbon, Arkhe is a trendy vegetarian haven that goes beyond the typical dining experience. While it proudly identifies as a vegetarian restaurant, its diverse tasting menu surprises diners with an array of innovative dishes that could easily make you forget about meat altogether. After indulging in traditional Portuguese fare, stepping into Arkhe feels like a refreshing escape from heavier meals.

sources.snippet: Precisely because of that, the Arkhe becomes the best option for the lovers of cuisine based on vegetables, and for all those who appreciate art ‚Äî this one, delicious and served in dishes. Even better is the highly sensory experience it provides to all its visitors.
sources.shortName: Restaurants for a romantic dinner in Lisbon

places.name: arkhe

reviews.text: The team welcomed me for my birthday, they made me feel special and welcome, and I even got to blow out a candle to mark the occasion! The food was also excellent, very bright and the tastes of spring were incredibly refreshing! I left very satisfied and completely full! I will definitely visit again upon my next trip to Lisbon!!

I was lucky enough to get a spot at the last minute through the waitlist, it is an intimate place so a reservation is a must. Delicious food and high quality produce. It is hard to compose a 7 course vegetarian menu at Michelin star quality but this place does it and it is relatively affordable. The music was a bit funky for my taste but it is a matter of preference and others might actually like it. The dining room is tastefully designed and the staff are knowledgeable about the dishes and attentive. High recommendation, keep on the good work

Some dishes were totally memorable and refreshing. All dishes were well balanced. Some were a feast of textures. It is one of the rare fine dining restaurants that I have visited and I have thought I'll revisit if I ever get the chance. I think the only weak points were the bread and the cheese platter, for my taste. They were quality products but they were not that great, relative to the other dishes. The bread was something I can easily make (One of my evaluation criteria is always whether I can make a similar food or not). Cheese platters have never been my favorites. This one wasn't an exception neither. It had some nice elements but I think they should always be optional at an additional cost.

places.address: Rua de S√£o Filipe N√©ri 14, 1250-227 Lisboa, Portugal

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the vibrant LX Factory, Ler Devagar is a charming bookstore that invites you to slow down and savor the experience of reading. This two-level haven boasts towering shelves brimming with books, alongside an eclectic mix of vintage records and art pieces. The industrial-chic ambiance, stemming from its origins as a former printing press factory, creates a unique backdrop for book lovers and Instagram enthusiasts alike.

sources.snippet: Ler Devagar was chosen as one of the most beautiful bookstores in the world by the NY Times. So besides exploring the curiosities of this store, you can of course get a new book and spend a slow afternoon enjoying each other‚Äôs company and that of a good book. The bookstore is also very instagrammable.
sources.shortName: 7 Original Date Ideas in Lisbon

places.name: Ler Devagar

reviews.text: We stumbled into this bookstore to escape the rain, and it turned out to be one of the best surprises! The selection of books is fantastic, with something for everyone, and the prices are very reasonable. What makes it even better is that it's not just books-they also have a great collection of art and records. The space is cozy and inviting, and we could've easily spent hours exploring everything. Whether you're a book lover, art enthusiast, or music fan, this place is definitely worth a visit! Highly recommend!

It was cute. But not worth the drive to get there from the city. What you see in the pictures is all that it is.
The bookstore is in a fun shopping area if you like to shop. But I do not recommend going just to see the bookstore.

A truly delightful and hip bookstore.
I wanted to buy an English translation of Pessoa and the staff was very helpful.
It's a beautiful and lively place, yet also calm and quiet.
I'd love to visit again.

places.address: R. Rodrigues de Faria 103 - G 0.3, 1300-501 Lisboa, Portugal
